{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3278472,"name":"Kerem Onur","username":"KerOn34","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/53a042/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-09T18:29:23.847Z","cooked":"

Hello guys, I recently received a WPI branded flash drive from this year’s FRC kit, and I noticed that its size is only 120 MB, which surprised me a bit. Does anyone have information on why it is this size or has experienced a similar situation?

IMG_06951920×1440 244 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-01-09T18:29:23.847Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":215,"reads":313,"readers_count":312,"score":1132.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":448952,"topic_slug":"why-is-wpi-flash-disk-has-only-120-mb-capacity","display_username":"Kerem Onur","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/7/d/7d5aa23768d6bce50a7dbbbc9350f01d7ff2bb1c.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51062,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/why-is-wpi-flash-disk-has-only-120-mb-capacity/448952/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3278480,"name":"Peter Cooper Jr.","username":"petercooperjr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/petercooperjr/{size}/240058_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-09T18:32:46.624Z","cooked":"

Prior discussion of it is here:

WPI branded USB thumb drive...? Kit & Additional Hardware
Anyone know if there’s a purpose to this? I’m generally not in the habit of plugging in random unsolicited USB drives into my computer, but I gave it a shot here and found it to be 128MB. Yes, you read that right, 1/8th of a GB. Can you even buy these anymore…?

I remember being overjoyed to get my first 128MB flash drive, which cost only $50. You could hold more than 80 floppies worth of stuff on it! Of course, you still had to use a floppy to load the driver for the flash drive onto Windows 98 systems.
